intro: Octarrhena saccolabioides, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a low-growing shrub with small, gray-green leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent stems and deep root system. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity. Octarrhena saccolabioides is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
